Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Stuart R
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris and it turned out to be all that we wished for and more. the hotel was lovely, very traditional, which is what we hoped for, but also very warm and comfortable. Most older hotels in Paris have small rooms, and although our room was quite small the 2 patio style doors opened up to give it a bright and airy feel. We stayed here for 3 nights, taking up the option of breakfast in bed, which was thoroughly enjoyable. We found the lady at reception very welcoming and helpful, a nice first impression of the Parisians. The location was excellent, 2 min walk to metro and just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: RoseNYC11
Reviews.Content: This place is a outdated dump....We stayed in the so called "executive suite" which reeked of mildew. The staff was not very helpful with bags and such and just leave it up to you to figure out where your room is. Everything in the room looked smelled and IS outdated!! there was even a dirty towel in the bathroom..I took pics and unfortunately, I lost my camera. This hotel gave me such a bad taste for Paris.. Please don't waste your money here!!!!! The wi-fi was horribe, the service was awful and the ambiance is depressing.

Reviews.Title: “about to get a re-furb apparently”
Reviews.Author: fearanti
Reviews.Content: well located property near Les Invalides. walking distance to the musee Rodin and to Tour Eiffel. One of the bateaux mouche stops (on the Seine, obviously) close to hotel (i.e. 15 min walk) pretty nice are in general, but Paris is walkable so nothing is that far from anything! Property is to be renovated, but found it a pretty decent example of a small Paris 3 star hotel. Room wason first floor with a little balcony, which was in shade at this time of year and looks on to other buildings. But would be nice for a smoker.

Reviews.Title: “Just crap!”
Reviews.Author: CLangcake
Reviews.Content: Do not stay there! Ongoing power outages and fire doors continuously opening and slamming closed due to the power outages. Couldn't sleep because door keep slamming every 5 -10 minutes. The staff seem fine with the on going power problem and no staff stood up to apologized just say that it happen sometime. The wall paper was ripped off and when we reported didn't seem surprise and said it was like that for ages :( Over priced and over star rated. Don't get sucked in by the professional photos. November 2011

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: anubis10
Reviews.Content: Been here twice. Last visit 2007. Way overpriced. Need to get a Jr. suite for enough room. That's over $400 and terribly overpriced. Neighborhood is good , not great. Had the same problem with cab to airport as others. It's a scam. I refused to pay the meter from point of departure. The hotel finally paid for it. No matter how well traveled you are it is hard to not get ripped off. After 14 trips to Paris at 10 different hotels I still have not found value. Well, maybe once. about 100 years ago when the Franc was at 10 to the $ we got a deal at the Crillon. It was great at about $200 a night. No way it's wolrth its current $700 minimum. C'est La Vie.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva1932
Reviews.Content: The location was nice, being close walking distance to good shops and nice places to eat as well as local transportation. The rooms were laughably small (I believe we were in a standard) where you could barely stand in the room as two people and shut the door. The service was fine - no issues but no one stood out as helpful either. (and, before you disregard my warning - yes I understand rooms in Europe tend to be smaller but this was a farce). It resembles a hostel in size with upgraded bathroom features but still tiny space. I was duped by the recommendations of charm and Parisian life. I would recommend staying at another property or upgrading to the best room they have - it is not worth the money for the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Chicest Boutique Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Puskon
Reviews.Content: Where do I start!? My experience at this hotel was just magnificent. On my late evening arrival I arrived and was greeted along with my boyfriend with a lovely Bonsoir. We booked this hotel for two nights for our two week stay in Paris. Upon exploring the city the next day and during our stay we were close to everything. A ten minute stroll from the Eiffel Tower and a two minute walk to the Metro- Ecole Militaire. Location is everything and this hotel located in the 7th Arrondissement was great. Our room was made up to the highest standards, breakfast to 11 was delicious, the staff were extremely helpful. They encouraged us where to eat and even booked us a table, (my French is not the best!) After our two nights stay we upgraded to a larger room and decided to spend another 12 nights here. On my next trip to Paris I would definitely return to this chic hideaway!

Reviews.Title: “Not four star luxury, but four star cleanliness and service”
Reviews.Author: upperwestsidemands
Reviews.Content: I stayed in their basic room and while it was plain and somewhat dated in is furnishing, the room and the hotel are well maintained and the service friendly and attentive. Friendly service and a clean room are not as common in Paris as they are elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: winesipper2
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in October 2011 for 3 nights, they actually KNEW that we had stayed there in the year 2000. Now that's amazing! This friendly little hotel is a gem and a good bargain considering the Tour Eiffel neighborhood. Modest size, but with armoire and bathroom shelves there's enough storage. The one thing they really need is a shower curtain - but you can make do. Good bed and towels. The staff is just great! And you MUST order the breakfast tray delivered to your room. Last time we always ate in the breakfast room, but this time we are sold on the breakfast tray, which is fast to come and really yummy. It's worth the price. Wherever they get their bread, it must have been a recent baguette contest winner! Superb, in a city with outstanding bread!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bluishlights
Reviews.Content: I loved our hotel. Even though we didnt have much of a view, other than a wall and a courtyard. Not that bad really. Who wants to admire Paris from inside a room anyway. Their front desk receptionist was very friendly and accommodating. We forgot adapters and they provided it to us with no problem. Its really close to the metro station, there's a food place next door thats open late, a cafe down the block, walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. AND FREE WIFI!! I can not emphasize how great it is to have free Wifi. My sister and I had a wonderful stay in Hotel Le Tourville and would definitely come back or recommend to friends. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Easy for newbies.”
Reviews.Author: Farfromthefarm
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It is in what I felt was a safe area with cafe's, bakeries, fruitstand/stores, atm and metro stop and the Grande Dame (Eiffel Tower) nearby. We could see the top of the tower over the trees from our windows that opened up to the avenue. The staff was very nice and spoke excellent English which was great since my French is poor and my daughter didn't know a word of French before our trip. Also they let us check in early when we arrived from the airport instead of storing our luggage which was a nice plus. Yes I've stayed in newer hotels with better amenities and bigger rooms. It was alot like visiting an auntie's or grandma's house and staying in the guest bedroom. If you bring lots of suitcases, love space and amenities and need lots of space and plug ins for your morning get ready time you may think of somewhere else. If you're traveling light and not spending much time in the room it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Lack Amenities.”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: We got a standard room, that cost about 210 Euros. At that price, I got an extremely small room, smaller than the typical bedroom in the average house. There was no in room bar nor a small refrigerator in the room. In addition, the only English speaking channel we could get was CNN. You cannot order any movies in the rooms. We had to speak with front desk nearly every day we were there to get room service to supply fresh face towels. Basically, only a place to lay your head. Not a great place to unwind after touring Paris. However, the hotel is a relatively short distance from the Eiffel Tower and the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastseabreeze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel le Tourville from Aug 24-27th and had a wonderful time. We had booked two rooms each with a King Size bed. Our rooms were facing the front with full length windows that faced the street. We loved our experience. The windows opened up to fresh breezes in the morning and the sounds of the neighbourhood, and closed at night to allow a very quiet and comfortable sleep with airconditioning if needed. The hotel is well managed and very clean. I had several questions answered by email before arrival and tickets ordered from a tour company were given to me in a sealed envelope when I arrived. David, the manager, was extremely helpful with all of our questions and requests. The hotel is a quick 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, but far enough away to avoid any crowds. There are several bars, restaurants, small grocery stores and bakeries, etc very close by to provide meals and snacks. The Batobus Eiffel Tower stop is approx 15 minutes away. Many Hop On Hop Off Tours drive right by - with stops approx 10 min walks away on either side. The metro is just up the street and around the corner and is easily navigated to anywhere in the city. Paris is an amazingly beautiful city - we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “SMALL BUT QUAINT”
Reviews.Author: poshbirdontour
Reviews.Content: Just back from Hotel le Tourville! It is rated as 4 star! Well, this would not relate to a four star in the UK We were advised not to base ourselves near to The Eiffel Tower - but we did! and - this Hotel location was OK. Plenty of restaurants round about - but most of them pricy! We spend 100 euros at Restaurant Romantica (nearby) for a bowl of linguini pasta and a bottle of wine (and 2 Proseccos!) We had a Superior room - size was good, however TV has ABSOLUTELY NO ENGLISH SPEAKING STATIONS! If you like to check on the news, this is not the place for you!! HIGHLIGHT IS BREAKFAST - CONTINENTAL - FAB U LUSS!!! Would go back just for the breakfast! Lovely staff serving also! Reception staff speak English. But do your research on Paris before you go! They don't give advice. Best meal out was at La Bouteille d'Or, with the lovely Kais as our waiter - just off the Batobus (boat) and across the road! Well worth a visit to the Restaurant - and the fab loos! www.boparis.com ENJOY! Get a 2/3 day ticket on the Red Tour Bus and hop and off as you like! Good value - so also is the Batobus on the river!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Silverback1965
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews we were looking forward to our stay and we where not disappointed. The "superior" room (no 58) overlooked the small courtyard and whilst it did not offer any view of Paris as the hotel backed onto various other appartment blocks we did not feel overlooked. As stated in other reviews the rooms are relatively small, but are not tiny and yes the shower would benefit from a screen/curtain to prevent the rest of the bathroom from splashes but overall they are more than adequete and comfortable.The staff are very helpfull and we received a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Pinkshoes518
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in good location. It had air conditioning and elevator. It also has a place to store luggage and nice front lobby. Staff spoke English and were helpful. It is very close to metro and a supermarket, which was nice not to have to pay hotel prices for water. It is close to Eiffel tower and Rodin museum (get a pass together to Musee D'orsay and Rodin museum to skip lines, but note that Musee D'Orsay is under construction) . It is close to restaurants, as well. Rooms were small, but not terribly small. They could use little renovation, but they were clean. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was very nice. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. I would not say that this hotel is worth its published rate €260, but definitely look for promotions and other hotel websites for better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot, very comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: TerryinAylmer
Reviews.Content: Well located and easy to get around, multitude of cafes and restaurants close by, try Ste.Dominique Street...easy walk to the Champs Elysee, Petit Palais, etc. Try to get a room facing the courtyard, very quiet and private, we stayed in #26...Very costly to get to the airport, ti's around 55 to 60 Euros, consider a shuttle, but be prepared for a wait...The RER is an option, be prepared to walk though, the station is around 4 blocks from the hotel. Staff was VERY coutreous anfd helpful. Get breakfast close by the buffet is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nhartung
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at Hotel Le tourville in Paris and had a wonderful time. My husband and 3 small children (ages 6, 3 and 18 months) and I stay in the suite which was adorable, good sized for a Paris suite and at an afforable price. My mother and sister stayed in a separate room that was equally good. It is well located in the 7th district close to many restaurants, Eiffel tower etc. The staff were very helpful and as I got ill with strep throat during our stay, made a physicians appointment for me. On our next trip to Paris we will be sure to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pysiu
Reviews.Content: When reviewing hotels in Paris one needs ot take into consideration, well, Paris. Thus, rooms will usually be small and pricess will be high. This hotel is located near the Eiffel Tower and UNESCO with several metro stops near by. THe hotel is nicely decorated but the rooms are of course very small with small bathrooms. There were renvoations going on in the corridors so there was some noise but I didn'tmind it so much. I had free wifi and free breakfast, which was quite good. The service was superior - very helpful and curtious. SOmething to keep in mind is that the hotel just recently sold so it is hard to say what it will be like under the new owner and what will change.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Harlequin25
Reviews.Content: This is a compact hotel, as is fairly typical of a traditional non-chain Parisian hotel. The public areas were very clean and tastefully decorated, as was the room (number 10). Indeed the hotel appeared as if it had been renovated fairly recently. Our room faced the road, but the windows were double glazed and we did not notice any undue noise. The bedroom was of a good size, for Paris, with separate bathroom and toilet. Very clean, nicely decorated and with antique style wardrobe and chest of drawers, the latter with a marble top. The bathroom was compact, but perfectly functional and clean. The bar on the ground floor is not particularly functional, as it is really nothing more than a drinks cupboard. However minutes sways there are multiple brasseries open til late, which are a great place to sit and chill at the end of an evening. Eiffel Tower is ten minutes walk. Champs Elysee is about 20 mins walk. Nearest Metro is a few minutes walk - Ecole Militaire. Top Tips: 1) we didn't try breakfast as there were a number if local brasseries nearby offering goods deals on breakfast at sensible prices, and with a good ambiance. I recommend Rue Cher, a few minutes walk from the hotel. Try the PTT brasserie - 6 euros for continental breakfast or 8 euros for American (lots of Americans seems to holiday in the area). 2) for dinner, again Rue Cher is a good place to look. A good ambiance and list of choice at sensible (by Parisian standards) prices. Just off Rue Cher, in Rue de Grenelle, there is a small Italian restraint called Di Felice. I can highly recommend it. Excellent 'real' Italian food, fresh pasta, freshly cooked and again at a sensible price. Also a nice small restaurant ambiance. 3) don't spend 14 euros a person on a one hour Seine river boat tour. Spend a few more euros (18) and you can get a two day pass for the Batobus which you can use on a hop on hop off basis for a full two days. OK you don't get someone in a microphone telling you the sights, but to be honest any basic guide book and map would tell you more. 4) book you Eiffel tour tickets online before you arrive. The queues are incredibly long, but if you book in advance you can bypass them. 5) Parisian taxis can be hard to come by. When you leave the hotel, it can be difficult for the hotel to get a pre-booking. The taxi will only come if the hotel call at the time you need it. Cut yourself some slack timewise when you leave, especially if you want a taxi to take you outside the Paris metro area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, the location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Swisslife2011
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Le Tourville. Walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Metro stop around the corner and bus stop across the street! Many cafes' within walking distance. David was most helpful and made our stay one we will remember fondly. We will be back! Claudia and Rick, Illinois USA

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: vaness20
Reviews.Content: Liked this small but very nice boutique hotel, rooms were good, very clean, staff very nice only thing it lacked was a bar area

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in great location with terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: PlasticMoonRain
Reviews.Content: My family and I lucked out by staying in the hotel's "Executive Suite" on the top floor, which can accommodate up to four people. We were traveling with our two young teens, so this saved us money right there instead of booking two separate double rooms. Our room had very comfortable queen size bed, with two single beds for our kids in what might be called an "adjoining" type of room. The decor was rustic and beautiful. Noise was minimal, even though you're in the general vicinity of the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. The bathroom was colossal and our kids LOVED the whirlpool. And after a day touring all over the city of Paris, that whirlpool can be a godsend. The 7th Arrt. is a great location in general. You can catch the metro at the Ecole Militaire stop and go just about anywhere. Of course, the breakfast prices were over the top at the hotel itself, so we went to many cafes in the area, which presented a much better value. I highly recommend going to the nearby Rue Cler, which Rick Steves justifiably obsesses about in his Paris books -- it's a wonderfully homey and very French street with all kinds of food shops and stores, cafes and restaurants. Each guest not only has a small safe in their room, but there is an additional safe for you in the lobby in which only you have the key to it. Speaking of keys, the keys to the room are quite huge and elegant, and thankfully, the front desk takes them before you leave for the day! There are two people who were especially helpful to us during our stay -- Alexandra and David. They will help book restaurants for you even before you arrive there. They were very friendly and helpful. Look, Paris can cost a fortune at the drop of a hat. Hotel Le Tourville is not cheap by any means but it is not exorbitant either. If you are looking to stay somewhere VERY nice and charming in a great part of Paris without breaking the bank compared to other very fine hotels, Hotel Le Tourville would make an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vinnie68
Reviews.Content: La tourville is small hotel but perfect, really cute little place. The staff are friendly and heplful. Breakfast was great and the location perfect only 15 minute walk from the eiffal tower so we walked there most nights. We stayed a week for our honeymoon and would go back. Its close to tube station, trains easy to use. Paris was lovely cant wait to go back. Eiffal tower, moulin rouge and disneyland are a must see, disneyland less than a hour on the train.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean hotel in quiet and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: islaazul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon in 2002 and like it so much we went back for our anniversary in 2009. The location is great--walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Rodin Museum, Invalides and the Metro is right across the street. There is a market around the corner and a falafel dive next door, and the best part is it's a quiet residential neighborhood. The staff is caring and nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! - WIFI available (but not for free)”
Reviews.Author: RickyCCS
Reviews.Content: In a brief: excellent location with great service. Paid WIFI. awesome breakfast. comfy and family friendly hotel. Close to pharmacy and grocery stores. Close to public laundry machines. Be prepared for taking a bath, as getting a shower will get all bathroom wet! - Located just two blocks from a Metro Station (Ecole Militare), two blocks from Ecole Militare (and close to Champ de Mars, Tour Eiffel) and also two blocks from Les Invalides. - I strongly suggest that with this and every other hotel you are going to book, do first a "google street view" walk around, so you can see the neighborhood, etc. - WiFI, which is an important feature for me (email, skype, backup photos online, etc), was available but for a price. Prices start around 8€ for 45mins (2010 prices) and don't have to be consumed on one session. You can buy cards in different time/price combinations at the lobby, or directly from your laptop with the ISP.Speed was about 4Mbps download (as tested with speedtest.net). Service provided by http://hotspot-wifi.fr/en/ - Breakfast was included in the rate and was EXCELLENT! - We had the privilege to be served by an older women who is very, very lovely. She will make your breakfast a pleasant experience. Breakfast buffet was modest: croissants, chocolate croissants (beware, this are addictive), cheese, ham, fresh baked bread and jelly, butte & dairies (yogurt, etc). Breakfast room is located in basement and has only around 6 tables. Very warmth and comfy. Breakfast does not include eggs by default (I don't know if they were available for an extra fee) - As other review mentions, our room was SMALL but comfortable. Our room had the back view from where you can see other apartments, windows from the buildings besides. Not an issue if you go the hotel mainly to get a good night sleep for the next day. I found this as an added value as we did not have any noises. Our room was quiet and clean, very clean. - We had the superior room with an extra bed for our 10 year old daughter. There was some room left for our two suitcases and two carry on. - There is a public (coin operated) laundry just one block from the hotel. There are also several restaurants by walking distance. - The pictures on their website are true to what you will find there. - Neighborhood is quiet and seems safe, even at night. - Staff is VERY helpful and they treat you as if you were their first, only and last guest ever. - Great value for the money. (yes, rooms are not the greatest, but the location premium pays for itself the first day!) - I will make only one suggestion to the owners. In the bathrooms, by just putting a piece of glass between the shower and the sink will help avoid spills when taking a shower.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous experience: from staff to room to breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: another-MN-traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed two weeks in this amazing hotel. Our room, a Superior with king bed overlooked the street. Large soundproofed windows allowed for quiet yet sunny, tree lined bustling street view. The room was spacious with plenty of storage space. The bed and pillows were comfortable: neither too firm nor too soft. Excellent quality linens were changed daily. The flat screen TV provided CNN and BBC Worldwide channels in English with excellent reception. The bathroom was modern. The towels large and fluffy. Toiletries provided were high quality. The shower was in the tub (large and deep). It was a mounted, hand held one with lots of hot water and strong water pressure. No shower curtain but it was easy to use by aiming the shower head at the wall while using it. Lighting was excellent with large mirrors. A hair dryer was available and, while not high powered, it worked very well for us. Topping this off was the outstanding staff. Alexandra arranged everything prior to our trip, making transportation to the hotel easy and helping us select a room exactly to our liking. She was available throughout our stay to assist and did so in a warm professional manner. David arranged for commercial tours to Bruges and to the champagne country, a Bateaux Parisiens dinner cruise on the Seine, restaurant reservations, taxi to the airport, and solved any wifi problem. He was patient, knowledgeable, friendly and always professional. Anne Marie served our breakfast daily with exceptional skill. She was friendly yet professional and always remembered our preferences. All of these people were delights and enhanced our trip beyond description. The location is extremely well situated, Near Rue Cler, a daily market street with cafes, cheese, wine, fish, vegetable and fruit vendors. The crepes from the Creperie Ulysee en Gaule's were the best we found in Paris. The hotel is about one block from the Ecole Militaire metro station but you can walk to many of the major sites. The Eiffel Tower , Rodin Museum and Ecole Militaire are particularly close. Lots of great restaurants are in the area. Overall, this was an exceptional experience and we recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Four Star????”
Reviews.Author: puzzeled
Reviews.Content: We were amazed at the four star rating. Having stayed in different hotels with different star levels in Paris, we were left shaking our heads over Le Tourville. Yes, it was clean and in a good location. But it stops there. Hotel lobbies are hotel lobbies plus nice receptionists can be helpful but the size of their best rooms are almost unlivable. There is nothing "grand" about it. Tagging along with my husband, who is on business ,I have seen at least 25 hotels around the world this year. This is the only one that did not provide the ability to make coffee in the room. As I said, I'm just amazed at the four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: johnson-kaiser
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, friendly, very helpful service from the front desk, in English if required. Room was very clean and comfortable for 2 adults + child. Location was very convenient to market, cafes, restaurants, metro, attractions. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: fabulous location, clean rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 415traveler
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an eight night stay at the Hotel de Tourville with my mother and sister. We were looking for a quiet, convenient location with good restaurants nearby and easy access to the Metro. We had two rooms - one standard and one superior room - and both were very clean and comfortable with nice street views. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were clean and there was air conditioning. The location is fabulous. The hotel is just a block or two away from a Metro stop and in close proximity to a few others. Hotel des Invalides/Napolean's Tomb is close by as well, and the Eiffel Tower is a short walk. The hotel offers breakfast each morning and the hostess is very welcoming and accommodating. Note that the 15 Euro price is not included in the hotel price. This seemed rather high to us, but when we ate elsewhere, we realized the benefits of bottomless cups of coffee at the hotel (we ate at the hotel the remainder of the time)! We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to others visiting Paris. The only minor inconviences (very minor) were the lack of a shower curtain (like most hotels in France, there is no shower curtain so water goes all over to a certain extent) and the WiFi not working in either of our rooms. Regarding the WiFi, note that you pay for a WiFi card; it is not free with your room. Although we couldn't use it in our rooms, we could use it elsewhere in the hotel and the front desk staff were again very helpful in trying to rectify the problem. Please note that neither of these were big issues and the positives completely overwhelmed these minor negatives. We cannot say enough positive things about the hotel staff, all of whom went out of their way to help us with dinner reservations, restaurant recommendations, sightseeing advice, etc. We had some wonderful meals based on their suggestions and managed to avoid a few long lines at the big tourist sites based on their advice.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: j0sephine54
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Le Tourville & stayed for 8 glorious days in June. The staff were most gracious, friendly & helpful. The room was clean, comfortable & perfect overlooking the trees & rooftops of Paris. The location was excellent with great cafe's & restaurants all around. We spent our days walking all over Paris (with the Metro conveniently nearby if necessary). Just up the road was the Rodin Museum, one of my favourite places. Le Tourville - a great place to relax after traipsing around Paris. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “It worked”
Reviews.Author: josiah97
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of June for 4 nights. Great location. After two nights we had a second reservation for a larger room (Superior) and were moved there. It seemed much bigger and I would recommend the larger room. The carpet in the halls should probably be replaced as it looks tired. Our room however was quaint. We never ate the expensive breakfast down in the basement but did have room service the last morning so we could get to the train station. It was worthwhile. The area is very convenient to all we wanted to see and the hotel staff was very helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: margaret094
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed the friendly, helpful staff. The location of Hotel Tourville is excellent! We walked miles and used the metro (station right by the hotel) as well. Alexandra and David wrote helpful emails to us even before we arrived, and she helped us check in at the airport the evening before our departure. Our room was very small, but the windows opened onto the street, so the room was always filled with sunlight. We were only there to sleep, so we didn't really care that it was tiny. The hotel was recommended to us by friends who had stayed there, and we will certainly recommend it to friends who are traveling to Paris. The price seemed terribly reasonable by Paris standards!

Reviews.Title: “Room 31 = Interesting”
Reviews.Author: JAG710
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying, this is not a room they normally rent out. But in the event that you have to sleep in this room, here are my comments. We were staying at a great hotel down the street, but they were booked one of the nights so they found us a room at this hotel. It was peak season so no one had rooms available any where, and this was the best they could find us. So room 31 is in the basement of this hotel. It's next to the breakfast area. The room (nor the basement) hasn't any windows! Considered illegal in the US, but we were desperate for a place to sleep! The room was clean I must say, except for the maroon carpet. The shower stall drain doesn't drain and the shower is quite small for a 190 lb. man. Don't drop the soap! The hotel check-in staff was really friendly, and made us at home for the one night. Point is - if you get stuck in this room it won't be the end of the world, but only make it one night...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location with excellent manager”
Reviews.Author: LoveLucy
Reviews.Content: I actually debated for about ten minutes whether to give this hotel 4 or 5 stars but taking everything into account I think it is a 4 star hotel with an excellent (10 star!) manager - David. He really made our stay special and is a genuinely lovely and helpful person. The other staff that we dealt with were ok - not overly helpful or cheerful but not overtly rude either. The rooms are very small but I would say they are ok for Paris standards. The bath is good but there is no shower curtain so watch out for the splashes on the floor! The aircon is great and the bed quite comfortable but smallish. The walls are fairly thin though - you can't really hear outside noises but if you are not an early riser then the neighbours may wake you up if they are leaving early. The breakfast is quite expensive (€15 - not sure if that is for one or two people) but as you can walk to Rue Cler and eat for €11 for two - I would suggest getting out and about. As I said, David was really helpful and can speak French, English and Italian. He went out of his way to call cabs, suggest restaurants, print directions, talk about our plans etc. The lady on the desk was not very helpful so really try to catch David if you want advice or a hand with something (eg, calling a cab for dinner). The location is about 10 mins to the Eiffel Tower and 5 mins to Hotel Invalides. It is not the most picturesque or quirky area but it is so close to the metro - it really doesn't matter. I liked watching business people and nannies with kids walking home. I would stay here again when I come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Petit n cozy”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLadyLea
Reviews.Content: I had a really nice stay in that hotel in the center of beautiful Paris. Clean rooms friendly service. Rather small rooms but as I said CENTER of Paris and the price is okay for that.

Reviews.Title: “Charming room and location, plus/minus staff”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter7273
Reviews.Content: Our room at le Tourville was very quaint with yellow walls, pink carpeting, floral curtains opening up to window boxes with plants, and a flat screen TV in the corner. The bathroom was modernistic with black marble and a large, white bathtub and sink. It was spacious by Parisian standards, but the walls are thin. We enjoyed opening the windows and letting the fresh air and sounds of Paris in. David at the desk was nice and helpful. The other staff were cool. They would help if asked directly, but were not effusively friendly or helpful. I like the Rue Cler neighborhood and enjoyed our stay here despite the less than friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MagsieDublin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but certainly not a 4 star. Small shabby room not anything like photos on website suggest. May have been chic and inviting 10 years ago but now in need of a face lift! please remove the carpt that is black around the edges. No comparison with the Le Walt around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of French Air!”
Reviews.Author: PhyllieC
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is really great, offering amazing afternoon and evening strolls, in a residential/ historic area, that is ideally situated between Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. The area is saturated in cultural interest, with the attractions of the Musée d'Orsay, Rodin and the like. Close by, is the Rue Cler, where you can loose yourself in an afternoon of shopping, interrupted only by the sprinkling of small charming cafes, where you can refuel, refresh and realish the delights of Parisian pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is gorgeous and le Tourville is a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelFairfaxVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Tourville hotel for one week in October. The location was very good. It's close to the metro. The rooms are very clean and the staff is extremely helpful. Each room has a private bath that was large and very clean. We throughly enjoyed our stay at le Tourville. When we travel to Paris again, we will definitely stay at le Tourville Hotel. My husband and I speak a little French. The staff was very courteous to us and would usually respond in French. The staff also speaks perfect English so there is no need to worry in case you do not speak French. We had a wonderful vacation in Paris and part of it is due to the lovely le Tourville.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the city of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Louth68
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem. If you are looking for a bedroom factory where nobody knows who you are then this is not the hotel for you. Great SERVICE from entry to exit exists here. Very comfortable bedrooms, a lovely breakfast each morning and drinks in the evening if you wish. All the staff here actually smile when they greet you and no rushing around. Lots of business guests here too so clearly a parisian favourite. My recommendation f you want to seee the sights of paris. Fantastic location too and only 15 - 20 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower, the Seine and many other attractions. Simply a 'must see' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfasts and good location, but no bath cloths, no reliable internet, and air-conditioning issues.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaArtseeker
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I checked in with a group of 5 AP Art students for an 8 day tour of Northern Paris while being based in the Tourville hotel. At first glance, the hotel was in a great location, and the rooms were very clean and charming, although quite small. Our two rooms housing the teens had to be moved twice due to air-conditioning issues and ants in one of the rooms. The room I shared with my colleague had a view of a brick wall, the shower did not have a curtain, and we had to constantly ask for face cloths for bathing, while having plenty of towels. The internet was offered via the purchase of a wi-fi card, however, it was most unreliable, as all of those in our group kept getting knocked off line. It was particularly annoying to try to send photos to family and friends who were expecting to be able to view them daily on our school's website. The antique dresser drawers were worn and difficult to open and close, and one of the drapes' tiebacks came loose from the ring and was not repaired from the second day onward during our stay. However, the cleaning lady did a great job and did not disturb our personal items, and the hotel staff was quite helpful with arranging transportation to/from the airport and supplying transportation schedules for the metro and train. Our saving grace came from the sumptuous breakfast our cheery waiter and waitresses served each day. The coffee, hot chocolate, basket of rolls and patisseries were wonderful, as was the ham, cheeses and fresh fruit and fruit juices. It is a charming hotel, but needs a good bit of TLC to keep its guests coming back AND recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: pcteacher
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this hotel. Rooms sorely in need of clean carpet, wallpaper peeling off walls, dirty public areas, worn towels. Had to change rooms numerous times due to air conditioning problems and insect issues. This hotel not even close to being a 4 star - realistically a 2 star hotel. Rates are totally out of line with the poor quality of the rooms and public areas. Extra charge for internet and quite difficult to connect.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal location with restaurants and metro station nearby - lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Jamdragon
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. The location is perfect - just walk around the corner and you can see the Eiffel Tower! We found the area magical at night with many people picnicing around the tower at night time when the tower is fully lit (and open til midnight). My partner was too scared to go to the summit - I went but I am scared of heights and found the lift a bit harrowing but the view is so worth it! Many people were dressed up as Michael Jackson with music playing under the tower - due to the recent sad news. A great atmosphere I never felt unsafe - there are the usual people trying to flog badly-made Eiffel towers, roses and champagne concealed in jackets. Police toured the area regularly. We dined at the restaurants close to the hotel both for breakfast and dinner. The food was supberb but be aware you will be paying for it! eight euros for a bottle of Heineken, coke and orange juice was six euros. Staying in this area means it will be expensive to eat/drink but if you don't mind walking you will save on travel costs. As has already been mentioned there is a Metro station just around the corner. We bought 10 Metro tickets for 11 euros and this was enough for our weekend between two of us. The hotel itself is charming - small rooms (normal in Paris) with toiletries and a view over the avenue and good air conditioning. The only odd thing about the roomwas that a double wardrobe faced the bed with the flat screen tv being located at the side - this meant only one person could see the fulls creen - we found this a bit idd but with the size of the room there was probably no where else to site it. There were very friendly and helpful staff who spoke back to me in english after I attempted some very poor french! DO NOT rely on staff for travel help though! I asked for a taxi the night before we were due to catch a coach to Beauvais airport. I was assured this would be arranged. We waited this morning in reception when the lady told us actually "you can't book them in rush hour and oh it seems to not be here, I can try them in ten minutes...." hmmm, bit of a risk. She suggested we take the 92 bus which goes direct to Porte Malliot....got on the bus, all the stops listed on the wall -Porte Malliot was not one of them!!!! This resulted in a mad dash on foot from the Arc de Triomphe luggage in hand in a bit of a panic! We got there in time thankfully. If travelling from Beauvais getting the coach is by far the easiest way to get into Paris - there were no taxis waiting at the airport, just coaches so it seemed the obvious solution - thirteen euros each one-way. We would definitely use this hotel again - the location is perfect and we never used a taxi once.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! It is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Clear213
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay in Paris. This will be our third stay at the charming Hotel le Tourville in four years. We usually book a superior double on the avenue. We return because of its great location. It has easy metro access and close by resturants. The staff is wonderful and welcoming. David and Ann-Marie have been particularly helpful to us. No question we ask is to much trouble to answer. This is a great place to stay in a large city if you like quiet small hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, fantastic staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: modine100
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at Hotel Le Tourville. We had a superior room, with a king bed, overlooking the avenue. It was nice and quiet and yet close to everything. The staff really was exceptional, especially David, who could answer any question was willing to help in any way. The hotel was charming and quaint and you felt like you were really in a friend's home in Paris. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: ModernDayNomad
Reviews.Content: I spent two night at Hotel Le Tourville in November 2008. It's a small, charming hotel in a quiet residential neighborhood of Paris. It occupies a simple, yet fantastically restored building near L'ecole Militaire. Its location is impecable; the Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk, Les Invalides is 10 minutes, too. There are dozens of restaurants and cafes within a few blocks and Ecole Militaire Metro Station is just steps around the corner. While the rooms were small, they were tastefully decorated, warm, and inviting. I stayed in the "Pink Room" which had two large windows overlooking Avenue de Tourville. At night, I could open the windows and listen to the sounds of Paris; it was intoxicating! The bathroom had been renovated and was very clean (if a bit small, too). There was a large wardrobe and a writing desk in the room, so there was plenty of space to store luggage and personal belongings. The lobby was stylish and inviting. The front desk staff were very friendly, fluent in English, and willing to help with even the simplest request (i.e. an umbrella, etc.) Everything about the hotel made it feel distictly Parisian. If you want to feel like a local in Paris, Hotel Le Tourville is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless, highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: banana64
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend trip to Paris, stayed at the lovely Tourville Hotel. Hats off to David the Concierge, kind, helpful, friendly, courteous. We had the superior room, room 34. It was lovely, just about the right size for Paris, but with two big full length windows, which added to the feeling of space. And the bathroom was spotless, along with the rest of the room. The location was perfect, for firstimers to Paris, it could not have been better. Around the corner from the metro, walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, walk the other direction about 100 yards for Les Invalides, Plenty of restaurants cafes and supermarkets within yards. We didnt hear a thing outside our window, we could not believe hwo quiet it was for a saturday morning, and we were back in our room by 11 or 12 each night and again, very quiet. We had a wonderful meal at the Tribeca restaurant in the street behind the hotel, the sweetest waitress ever, beautiful food, that didnt break the bank. I loved the area, loved the hotel and its location and would definately go back here again. The only reason I wouldnt reccomend it to my friends is because I wouldnt like to share it!!! A wonderful experience indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WoodyNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: My group had 5 rooms for 4 nights. The rooms were very clean and the staff could not have been better. Great location close to the tube. You cant go wrong with this property

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel le Tourville”
Reviews.Author: Assie55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel le Tourville for 9 fantastic days. Our room was a superior room, plenty of space and very clean. The location was perfect for us. It was in a beautiful tree lined street, the Metro is around the corner, not far from the Eiffel Tower and the River Seine. The staff were all very helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. We can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jmb08
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon at Hotel le Tourville. We were there for 6 nights and had a great stay. Our room (#38) was plenty big and had a queen bed and nice bathroom for 160 euros a night. Everything was clean, well taken care of, and quiet. The staff was friendly and very helpful in making recommendations and arrangements for us around Paris. The metro is right there as are quite a few cafes, bakeries, etc. The Eiffel tower is practically right around the block. We would not hesitate to stay here again if we ever return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Compact, Clean, Well Located, but badly treated”
Reviews.Author: grainneuiloinsigh
Reviews.Content: Nice, Compact, Clean, Well Located, but badly treated My husband and I stayed at the Hotel le Tourville in June. We were celebrating a our 30th anniversary and our daughter booked us into Tourville based on the hotel's proximity to Le Tour Eiffel. The location is great, the rooms were small but that is not untypical for Paris, the hotel was clean and bright. We enjoyed our stay. I would have been able to give this hotel a 4 out of 5 review were it not for the rude treatment we received on departure from the hotel after our two night stay. My daughter had arranged payment for the room in advance, as she had also done with a number of other hotels that we had visited on our trip. My daughter had confirmed this by telephone and email. My husband and I verbally confirmed this when we checked in. However, the front of hotel staff was horribly misinformed and insisted, rudely, that we settle the bill. I was terribly insulted, and embarrassed as I was unable to explain the situation given that the staff member was rather unapproachable. Repeated attempts to contact the hotel to have the charge reversed and simply put onto my daughters credit card as pre arranged have been ignored. We are so disappointed that the wonderful stay in Paris at Hotel la Tourville was tarnished by one staff member and management's unwillingness to simply put right what they had agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Charm”
Reviews.Author: Travel2010around
Reviews.Content: Arriving at this hotel I was charmed by the fantastic exterior and instantly knew we made a good choice, the lobby is small but nice. The rooms were also small but as Paris goes you just need them to sleep in. The hotel is in the fantastic 7th district and is close to several metro stations. The staff were very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. I would definitely stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Le Tourville”
Reviews.Author: blufla
Reviews.Content: Loved the area -- just off the noiser streets and near the Eiffel Tower. Lots of good restaurants, quiet beautiful streets & good shopping. The hotel staff was helpful & knowledgeable. The hotel was clean, fairly newly remodeled, large storage armoire, nice bathroom. Room was small, but we liked it. Great long windows which we left open. Decent hairdryer. A few strange things -- no wash cloths (we had to borrow them from the powder room in the basement every morning); the shower had no wall separating the tub from the vanity (water everywhere every morning!); the original room information stated we would have a safe in the room, however, no safe -- only in the suites. One other thing -- the number of English-speaking TV stations! We were really sick of the never changing CNN stories! Aside from CNN & BBC, not much else.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: a_diner
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant, quiet, small room in a wonderful location. The staff were VERY nice. The bed comfortable. It's nothing fancy, but met our needs. The breakfast is way overpriced and not very good, but it was easy. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jillef
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in April. Rooms are tiny but clean, with hair dryer the only real amenity. Lobby is pleasant but small. Front desk staff were helpful except for woman who gave incorrect information and was cold. I asked her where to catch the #69 bus listed in Rick Steve's guide and she noted the bus did not go where the book said it did. She said to take a complicated series of buses instead. (P.S the book was correct, she was not). Hotel is in a safe area, close to the wonderful Rue Cler food area, @10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower , and right by a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “why go here?”
Reviews.Author: sanfranguy10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights based on recommendations in guide books and pictures on websites. Now that I've been, I'd never go back. Le Tourville lacks charm and is in an area that basically closes down at night. The restaurants within a few blocks are mediocre. Sure, Le Tourville is close to the subway and some museums. But when there are great neigborhoods all over Paris, why stay among government buildings and block-long concrete museums. The charming streets that Rick Steves so fond are few in number and have long ago been taken over by other tourists carrying his guides. A quick walk around other parts of Paris (e.g. the left bank or marais areas come to mind) were enough to convince me that there's so much more than this.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: LAtahoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a one week stay in Paris and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Tourville Hotel. The hotel is ideally located walking distance from the Eiffel tower, in a residential ( very SAFE!!) area. We did a lot of walking as major attractions such as Louvre museum, Orsey, and Champs Elyses are not too far. We just loved being able to walk in a such nice neighborhood. Metro stops are also very close but the weather was so sunny that we decided to walk most of the time! Hotel staff are so helpful, Peggy & David gave great restaurant recommandations, helped us with directions and always interact in a subtle manner. We dined at La Fontaine de Mars, local restaurant with friendly staff and at Les Ombres. This is a new restaurant inside the new Quai Branly museum. The decor is just amazing, with impressive view of the eiffel tower. We stayed in a superior room, which was very comfortable. Now we are used to european standards so we expected a tiny room, but the room was much larger than at the Verneuil were we usually stay. All in all, a great stay in the city of lights. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: KKWWestSussex
Reviews.Content: What a rip off!! This was such a disappointment. We wanted a well-earned romantic Valentine weekend in lovely surroundings. The hotel's website photos gave the impression that this hotel warranted it's 4* rating but the reality is that it is no better and in some cases with much less facilities than other 3* hotels I've stayed at in Paris. We upgraded to a superior room because it offered a private terrace. The terrace was completely overshadowed by the tall buildings only feet away around it that made it cold, dark and uninviting - we didn't use it. The room was very small and there were lots of little annoyances, e.g. no tea or coffee making facilities, the 'international' TV had only a handful of channels, only English speaking one of which was CNN, no film rental, no mini bar, no shower curtain so the spray from the shower went all over the water stained marble washbasin counter. It was all very 'basic' and the bed was really uncomfortable. One reviewer has mentioned how quiet the hotel is. We were in room 18 and we heard a lot of bathroom noises from another room. The decor and furnishings were nice but with everything being so small and compact you didn't want to spend any time there. The breakfast room is nice and cosy down in the cellar. The only morning we had breakfast there, the waitress was clearing away the buffet when we arrived at 10.30 ( though they serve until 11.00). Two other parties arrived after us and both of them were served their coffee before us. We had to ask the waitress 3 times before it arrived. We of course had a wonderful time in Paris away from the hotel and though it is in a pretty good location, I can't honestly recommend it unless they downgrade it. Definitely not worth the money they charge and I would love to know how they got 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tourville in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pogo42
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clean darling hotel with character and great location. Bilingual staff very helpful and courteous. Close to metro, Eiffel Tower and many major historical sites and museums.Lots of great food markets in walking distance. Be sure to get something from Letore bakery around corner which has some of the most exceptional pastries and deserts in Paris.. Although bedroom was small it had nice decor and heavy curtains. Windows face onto a fairly quiet street for that area. We slept great. Loved it there.

Reviews.Title: “Tourville is Terriffic!”
Reviews.Author: zinful
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tourville for 5 nights at the beginning of November. From check-in to check-out everyone was plesant and accommodating. David at the front desk was wonderful. Everyone spoke english. You leave your key with the front desk when you leave for the day/night and when you return, if the front desk person hadn't met you yet they asked questions without being rude to make sure you were the right person to give the key AND they always recognized and acknowledged you with a smile, even when awakend at 3am! Our room was on the street and noise wasn't a factor. A very residental area without a lot of sirens, bus stops outside the window or school children in the early morning. The bed was comfortable, the room clean and spacious (in European standards). The bathroom was large and the shower perfect (alas, no shower curtain) and the towels large and soft. During our stay we purchased a bottle of champage for a picnic the next day at the Eiffel Tower and asked if they could keep chilled - no problem, can you make reservations for us at this restaurant - no problem. We didn't partake in the breakfast served in a basement/cellar room - there were plenty of bakeries in the neighborhood to get a snack in the morning or the grocery store around to the corner for fruit, juice and pastry for about 2 euro instead of 12 euro. A lap top computer with internet access - 5 euro for 45 minutes. A short 3 or so minute walk to the metro, 10 minutes to the Eiffel Tower, 5 minutes to Rue Cler, and MANY yummy restaurants (highly rated Zagat ones) within a 10 -20 minute walk. There were other hotels in the area - one next door with rate posted much lower than what we paid but the dirty windows, plastic chairs and a dead plant on the front desk made me glad we paid extra for a room at the Tourville. I think we paid about 220 euro a night, a bit more than we usually pay but it was for my 40th birthday and we would be arriving tired from a busy time a work. It was worth every euro!

Reviews.Title: “Have the appropriate expectations. Not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: MmeSheppy
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel - - I think this is what trips people up about this place. If it were rated and priced appropriately, it would have more consistent reviews. The good things: lovely, helpful, (mostly) English speaking staff. Decent neighborhood. Rue Cler is amazing. Metro is close. Breakfast was delicious - delivered to your room promptly whenever you choose (better then a wake up call) and a good deal. Down sides: The rooms are marginal at best. Our room just didn't feel that clean. It had clearly just been vacuumed, but there were permanent brown stains on the carpet and mildew in the tub. Pretty unappealing. The w/c was separate from the rest of the bathroom and had a permanent and unpleasant smell. Furniture was cheap - handles literally broke off in our hands. Also, there is no air conditioning after September 30th - they turn over to heat. It was warm when we were there. We opened the windows, but because we had a room on the avenue, it was then very loud. And speaking of loud, walls are paper thin. The couple next door had a wicked fight. We felt like we were standing between them! However, if you have the appropriate expectations, you will very much enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: rapveron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 9-wonderful days in Paris and a memeroable experience for our 25th wedding anniversary. We selected the hotel from the internet, booked it thru the internet, site unseen and without reading any reviews. We heard many stories about hotels having restrooms/bathrooms not in the room, therefore, having these facilities in the room became a priority. Using this criteria as well as Left Bank we hit upon the Hotel le Tourville; I cannot say enough about this hotel and staff. Very quaint, well appointed and charming, some 30 plus rooms, some with balconies (we did not have a balcony), but that was okay. It room was wonderful located on the 3rd floor with two windows looking onto a courtyard. The hotel is located on the Left Bank just a short walk to the Tomb of Napoleon, Eiffel Tower, and two blocks from the metrotrain..........a block and a half from shops which Julia Childs used when in Paris...............wow. The staffs only interest is making sure your experience is the best humanly possible. Booking restaurants, explaining where and how to get there, booking sight seeing tours and recommending personal things they enjoy in Paris made our stay an unforgettable one. Actually, we plan to return, Lord willing and Hotel le Tourville will be our hotel choice. David and Peggy, (hotel satff members) did everything possible to assist, direct and advise us, we will not forget their sincere hospitality. There were others just as polite and helpful, unfortuantely I do not recall their names. All their recommendations were excellent. The staff scheduled a shuttle to pick us up at the airport and had one there to take us back. Five stars is all I can give based on this questionaire, if more were available they would have them. After arriving we noted the hotel is a four (4) star rated hotel, something we did not know before arriving. Recommending them is the easiest thing and I consider it a blessing to do so. Rex and Priscilla

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Kay0855
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights this summer and had a great experience. The first night, our second story room did not have A/C so they provided a fan, which served well. However, when they could not fix the A/C on the following day they moved us into a (larger) room on the first floor. We preferred the higher floor, but A/C was more important since it was in August. Only problem with this room is that it is directly behind the reception desk in the lobby and the person there has a chair that scrapes every time they move it -- we suggest to the hotel management that they get a chair with wheels or put the one they have on a rug or carpet -- a fairly easy fix to make the customers in that room happier!! The staff in the lobby were extremely helpful! All of them spoke English very well. Another reviewer has said that there was no place for any extra luggage, however we were able to have our extra luggage (which we did not need to access during our stay) kept in a closet in the lobby, so didn't have to worry about it taking up space in our room. Tips for any one planning on staying here: There IS ice in the lobby - just ask for it; the windows are very well insulated as far as keeping the noise out which we very much appreciated; several excellent cafes within two blocks; L'Open Tour bus stop only about one-and-a-half blocks away (you can almost use this as your "local" bus with a several-day pass, which is what we did); there is a bodega-type store a few doors down from the hotel entrance when you want some cheap eats/drinks; we had breakfast brought to our room in the mornings, and it was MORE than adequate and brought at exactly the time we had requested. Another suggestion for the management: Install some type of partition at the shower head end of the tub, a glass wall would work well. Without anything currently there during our stay, water from our showers went all over the sink/counter every time we bathed. This can be solved fairly easily and would make the bathrooms a lot more user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Parfait!”
Reviews.Author: rtravels
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Paris at the Tourville and loved both the city and the hotel. This was our first trip to France and the hotel exceeded our expectations. We splurged on a room with a private terrace and it was well worth it...we spent every night outside our room drinking a bottle of wine underneath the Parisian sky. Although small by general American standards, the room is actually quite large when compared to similiar hotels in New York. It's well decorated in pastel colors with fun, anitque furniture and a nice bathroom. The curtains are very thick and the hotel amazingly quiet so be warned...there's a good chance you'll sleep better here than at home. We had a hard time getting out of bed every day simply because there was no disturbance (light, noise, housekeeping) to wake us. The front desk was very nice and helpful and the room spotless. As for the neighborhood, you can't beat it. You are steps away from beautiful cafes, about two blocks from the rue cler street market and a short stroll from the Eiffel Tower. Also, the Ecole Militare Metro stop is very close. If you don't pick this hotel, at least consider staying in this neighborhood. Overall, a dream trip and a beautiful place to call home for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank Gem”
Reviews.Author: Maines
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Le Tourville is blessed with an exceedingly amiable and helpful staff, as well as an ideal location for those who want to experience Paris "a pied". Near the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides, with parks and the Seine as well as public transportation easily accessible, this hotel has plenty of amenities but fits into a quiet, pleasant neighborhood. The rooms are small but comfortable, with well equipped private baths, and are tastefully decorated and clean. We recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationaddictnyc
Reviews.Content: The reviewers are all correct, a nice, clean, helpful, and very quiet little hotel in a very safe and quiet residential part of Paris. Not perfect, but what is. My wife and teenage daughter and myself survived a week in a small room together and had a great stay. We had the ground floor room off the lobby that has a small office adjacent to it. The ringing phone would wake us in the morning, but we used it as an alarm clock, we didn't mind but those wishing to sleep in later would not like it. I wish this hotel was located in the Luxembourg Gardens area that is more a student area with lots of inexpensive restaurants, shopping, etc. But I would be tempted to go back because the front staff were very helpful and made our stay more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and enjoyable location”
Reviews.Author: Tennistime
Reviews.Content: Recently spent eight nights here on our first trip to Paris. Crisp linens every day in a very small but quiet room with nice view. Ask for the fifth floor. Staff was awesome, always willing to help, and made reservations each night for us for dinner. You can order breakfast for one (plus one egg) the night before to be sent to your room (enough for two of you, to save a few euros): one plain croissant, one chocolate, one baguette, yogurt, great orange juice, and a good pot of coffee with hot milk. Breakfast room is very nice and service terrific. TV was tiny and no CNN as promised on the hotel notes. No radio. Clean, good-sized bathroom with not quite a shower. Wonderful location looking out on pretty residences and you could feel almost like a resident and not a tourist. Very pretty lobby. Rick Steves' Paris 2007 noted this hotel and we love his books. We got a very good rate on the hotel web pages. Early March is a great time to see Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: c.h.s.p
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel. The website made it look so crisp and clean, but I found the actual hotel itself to be a bit dingy with cracked paint on the walls and bad carpeting. The staff was pleasant however, and it was quitely located in a residential neighborhood. It was a short walk to the Eiffel Tower, which was great, but if I were to go to Paris again, I think I would stay by Notre Dame, which was more centrally located to a majority of Paris' major sights.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel in the heart of paris”
Reviews.Author: 205jam
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to tell anyone about this little left bank boutique hotel 'cause I want to keep it all to myself!!!! Everything about this hotel is wonderful. Our room overlooked a small terrace with lush foliage, had a great king sized bed, large bathroom, a very clean and well furnished room and most of all - it was very quiet. The location, adjacent to the Rue Cler neigborhood, was perfect for shopping, good food and great people watching. It is like a little oasis in the heart of Paris. At the front desk was dear Peggy-who was a wealth of information and always had a smile for everyone. The staff was most efficient in getting anything we needed and quickly too. There is no doubt as to where I will stay on my next visit to Paris- Hotel Le Tourville!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Critical_But_Fair
Reviews.Content: For the money, you will be hard pressed to beat Hotel le Tourville. As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are quite small, but they have all of the amenities you really need for those on holiday (not for business travelers). Especially nice bathrooms. Very colorful throughout. Ask for rooms on the first floor with a private terrace. The surrounding neighborhood is residential, and there is a Metro station two blocks away. The Eiffel Tower is less than a 15-minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffv1810
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel. Only 30 rooms, but the front desk staff is great (especially David) and they speak very good English. Rooms are small, which is typical, but very clean and well appointed. The location is great - just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, a block from the Metro and a short walk to Rue Claire (a must see for local food market). Many neighborhood bistros, cafes and shops nearby. I would highly recommend this hotel - decent rate and great service.

Reviews.Title: “super small hotel”
Reviews.Author: muylle
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel, but very hard to get rooms as they are constantly booked.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Voila!
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 5 nights and we loved it! It was very "french" with feminine and beautiful touches to the lobby and our superior room. The front desk was VERY friendly and helpful every time that we needed them. The location was ideal to the metro, eiffel tower, and rue cler where we ate breakfast every morning. Also, the air conditioning was perfectly cold. (unlike many european air-conditioners) We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: slocal
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our five night stay at this cozy hotel well located in the Rue de Cler neighborhood near the Eiffel Tower. Our rooms (the least expensive) were quite small, but very clean and well maintained with pleasant decor. The bathrooms had tub and shower, which was nice. We would have like some sort of partial enclosure to keep the shower spray from getting over other parts of the bathroom, which was completely tiled. The air-conditioning was excellent and the double-paned windows provided excellent protection from street noise. The beds were comfortable and kept very clean on a daily basis. We received excellent recommendations for good and reasonably priced restaurants, and there were plenty to choose from and a small grocery store around the corner. It was near a metro stop and we liked the less busy, less touristy location. We felt very safe and the newly renovated lobby was pleasant and comfortable. The staff spoke excellent english and were efficient and courteous. Assistance was readily given when requested and there was someone on duty at the entry desk at all hours. Would definitely return there for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Très Charmer!”
Reviews.Author: 2trvl
Reviews.Content: Divine and overflowing with charm. It is the perfect location as everything is so accessible. Our room (we splurged on one with a terrace) looks exactly like the website photos. It was quiet, there was plenty of space for clothes in closet and in dresser. Every night we would get ice from concierge (and real glasses) and have cocktails on the terrace. (The rooms don’t have a minibar, but the hotel does have a bar in the lobby however we just bought vodka and tonic from the store down the street.) The staff was most accommodating, especially Charlotte – who made an error in the reservations so my son had to have the basement room the first night but we were not charged. She was so apologetic. (The room wasn’t a bad size but it didn’t have a window and my son said it was noisy in the morning while they were serving breakfast.) The next day, they moved his bag to his new room while we were out sightseeing. (And they did have a porter for our things when we arrived.) One of the ladies was actually upset that she didn’t remember which room our son was in so she didn’t have his key ready! The next room my son had was a standard room on the ground floor. It was a nice size and there were bars on the window for security. Peggy was also helpful. She recommended the water taxi which is a nice alternative to the metro, though we used the metro a lot because the stop was so close to the hotel. We ate at nearby restaurants most of the time. The Indian Restaurant next to the hotel, in particular was very good. It served the best chicken curry ever. Rue Cler is a very quaint area to walk around in. There is also a launder-mat on the way to the metro, next to the bank, should anyone need to wash a few things and the post office is also nearby. The two minor minuses: the hairdryer was almost pointless – it was hot, but it didn’t really blow. And, of course, no shower curtain – but this is common so hardly worth mentioning. Believe me, I will always recommend this hotel to anyone I know going to Paris – I hope we get to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A real winner”
Reviews.Author: Ortrude
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 15 nights at this lovely hotel. The staff was extremely cordial and helpful without being intrusive. The hotel was tasteful, immaculately clean, very quiet, with good beds and comfortable chairs. The location was perfect - within 5 minute walk to metro, Eiffel Tower, bank, bakeries, fruit stands, grocery stores, laundromat, and at least 8 excellent restaurants. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Spoda
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay in the Hotel Tourville, on a vacation with my family. We found the hotel to be extremely clean and comfortable, and the location is fantastic. The front desk staff were very helpful in every way. Metro stop (Ecole Millitaire) and taxi stand are nearby. Highly recommended small hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: jltaylor
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great - walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Ecole Militaire, Invalides, and Napoleon's Tomb. It's also right around the corner from a metro stop. I spent very little time in the hotel, preferring to be out in Paris instead. Breakfast was excellent (and fresh, unlike some other reviewers' experiences). The staff were courtious. It took a couple of times to get used to leaving the room key with the front desk on the way out, but it really was more convenient not to have to carry it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at hotel tourville for a week stay and had the time of our life. The hotel is located is in a lovely area walking distance to the eiffle tower. The weather was not so great but still we had time to enjoy the Louvre museum and went to versalles castle, outside Paris. Our room was big enough and beautifully decorated. The staff was very friendly and made great restaurant reservations. Can't wait for our next stay. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Davidsad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel le Tourville for 6 days in May. It was terrific, as most of the reviews indicate. We arrived early on Sunday morning, and the staff, knowing that we had an overnight flight, had our room all ready for us. They were so helpful throughout our stay. Our room was a suite on the top floor: spacious, comfortable, with a large bathroom and storage space. It was quiet at night, and had a nice view. And the Rue Cler neighborhood can't be beat. It is very Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel le Tourville is a wonderful, charming little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel le Tourville is a small boutique hotel. It is not a large chain hotel, and no one checking in should expect the extras that come along with the larger hotels - i.e. full service dining, exercise facilities, conference center, etc. That being said, the hotel is a charming, comfortable little oasis with a relaxed reception area (with some very interesting and OLD books on display). The rooms are small - but so what? They are neat, well-maintained and cheerful. Breakfast is simple but more than sufficient. The staff was always attentive and ready to assist. Because there are only 30 or so rooms in the building, the staff, particularly the front desk staff, quickly learn the faces and names of those staying more than a couple of nights. This creates a feeling that you live here, and are not simply renting a room for a few days. Myself and my traveling companion each requested early check-in on our arrival and were greeted with rooms ready at 9 AM. The neighborhood is a quiet, residential place with several fine restaurants and shops close by. The Eiffel Tower and the Invalides are short walks away. Should I ever return to Paris, I will be staying at the Hotel le Tourville, and I will recommend it to anyone I know who is traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Average Rooms, best for the pricing. They have proper room service. .. Phones work and your kins can reach you.. Bathroom is cramp but clean. I rate them above average.. I will be travelling in June/July and stick on with them.

Reviews.Title: “nice room,poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the eiffel tower.We loved our room,however the staff is very rude and unpolite.We were supposed to stay 4 nights but left after 2. No recommendation,no smile,we asked about museums and transport,the lady at the front desk doesn't know anything.She always said "I don' know". We will never send anybody to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: areader
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Le Tourville in June, 2005 for four nights. We had a lovely stay and preferred the quiet location as we enjoyed returning to our peaceful little neighborhood at the end of each day. We dined within a few blocks of the hotel each evening and we highly suggest you seek the recommendations of the hotel staff. All references were excellent. Tourville's location was perfect for strolling over to the eiffel tower after dinner which we really enjoyed. The breakfast room was cozy and very tidy during our stay. The bread products were perhaps not the freshest, but we enjoyed the ability to dine in prior to heading out for the day. We paid for convenience, however, if you are looking for quality, you may prefer to dine elsewhere in the morning.
