For our next visit, we will book a Superior room as the Standard double is TINY...barely any space to walk with luggage. We attempted to upgrade upon arrival (after seeing the room). It was possible for us to upgrade, however we would be charged for both rooms that first night as housekeeping had already left for the evening and even though we only stepped foot in the room, they would not have been able to rent the room that evening. Not the best customer service. The bathroom in our room was tiny....not the best products, and you could just about hop out of bed and land in the bathroom, which was unexpected after viewing the pictures of the hotel. This is a small hotel, definitely comfortable but has some quirks which are easy to live with considering the room rate and its ideal location. Be prepared to leave your key with the desk and yes, I was able to get a pot of hot water for tea each evening, delivered to our room. I am a very fussy hotel guest and this is a very clean, comfortable, and charming hotel, ideally located and we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Maid stole my wife's ear rings”
Reviews.Author: pitttrader1988
Reviews.Content: Great neighborhood. Great cheese shop nearby (Mme Cantin). It is a litte out of the way for the major touristy stuff. Maid stole my wife's ear rings, and the front desk was no help. Ruined a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful folks.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very cold Saturday morning with jet lag. The woman at reception said our room was not ready as we suspected but she would make it a priority. We stumbled off to the Eiffel Tower dead on our feet but returned with the hour to find the room ready. Room was small ( we had a basic room with a double bed) but what we expected for a Parisan hotel. Bathrooms were good sized, ironically half the size of the room. Reasonably clean. I carry ear plugs with me on European trips for hotels are usually noisy. The window were well insulated and interior doors kept this hotel very quiet and I did not need to use them. The breakfast room we found clean and the food good...croissants, yogurt, eggs for extra if you want them. Reception desk and breakfast folks were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “avoid the breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay, our room was clean and enough spacious for just 2 nights stay. People at the reception was polite. Location is great, near Eifffel tower and shopping street. Just avoid the breakfast at the hotel, the dinning room is dusty and not well maintained, poor service and poor items. Is was not included in the rate, we tried it once and were not satisfied at all, we told to the reception about that and said they will look after those problems but when we went again the next morning nothing as changed, so we just left. The Hotel is pleasant, just avoid the breakfast there, you will easely find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Always LeTourville”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is nice little but very comfortable hotel with excellent staff and service. Morover, the hotel is strategically located in a nice neighborhood in the 7th, which makes it easy to go all over Paris. It's really a nice place to stay while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved le Tourville”
Reviews.Author: xnerg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week's stay in Paris and found the Hotel le Tourville to be charming, well-appointed, friendly and very clean. The room, for European standards, was quite satisfactory in size, and the newly-redecorated bathroom covered in marble was fabulous, also quite large for a European room. We had a "Superior" Room, which was a little larger than the regular rooms. It was nicely decorated and nicely appointed, and the bed was quite comfortable. The staff was quite friendly and always helpful and went to great lengths to make our stay enjoyable, including making reservations for us and recommending nearby restaurants, giving directions and suggestions as to where to go and where to eat. They were also quite willing to correct problems; our television set did not get any English-speaking stations, and they happily changed the TV the very next day so we could watch CNN and BBC. We will not hesitate to stay at le Tourville again when we go to Paris, hopefully next time in warmer weather!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not a 4-Star”
Reviews.Author: FairBalanced
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a junior suite here in Sept 2005. Overall we liked the hotel very much, primarily because of a very helpful, friendly staff and absolutely great location. Our room, though not that large, was nicely decorated and comfortable, but not 4-star by US standards, (eg plastic cups, tricky lighting system, and no comfortable chairs on which to sit). Bath was large and well equipped. Beds were comfortable with good linens. This neighborhood is great and we will have fond memories of this somewhat pricey boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: 12DLM2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris. We loved staying at Hotel le Tourville. This adorable hotel was just a few blocks from the Eifell Tower. Ask for a room with a balcony... Lots of sidewalk cafes in the area...great food in all directions. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The bathrooms were large and modern, comfortable mattresses, tasteful decor, and a peaceful location. We will make this hotel our home base when ever we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: NCTravMorrisville
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all of our expectations. We had a junior suite on the top floor(6th) for our family of 2 parents, 18-year old son, and 14-year old daughter; king bed, and 2 single beds. Room was very spacious, with large closet. Room was also very quiet. Bathroom was great! Large tub, double sinks, toilet, and separate enclosed shower. Lobby is small but attractive. Location of hotel is ideal for walking to sights or catching the Metro. Plenty of eateries close by. Breakfast room is small and quiet. My only negative is that the breakfast is probably overpriced. We ate there twice because of the convenience. The staff is very warm and accommodating, excellent at speaking English. They were also happy to speak French to our son who is studying in high school. Their restaurant recommendations were superb. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh la la!!”
Reviews.Author: tripdenver
Reviews.Content: This is by far our favorite hotel in Paris. Just got back from a 4 night stay in February. The staff (Peggy, Charlotte and David) are extremely helpful! They made reservations for us, called cabs, had very good restaurant recommendations. Rooms are pretty and comfortable. It's very close to the Metro (less than 2 blocks). Paris hotels are expensive and this is at the high end of our budget but it was worth it. Breakfast is 12 euro - I thought pricey initially but you get quite a bit - yogurt in little glass jars, cereal, cheese, croissants, baguettes, pain au chocolate plus lots of good coffee - all presented beautifully in a gorgeous breakfast room. A perfect way to start your day. I recommend to go ahead and pamper yourself and stay at Le Tourville.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully french”
Reviews.Author: fionac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days from 22 January 2005. We loved the hotel and thought it was good value for the price (170 euro per night). Hotel is very small but very beautiful, clean and cosy. Positon is great - plenty of brasseries, bistro's and cafes very very close. A little grocery shop also nearby. A laundromat one minute around the corner. Metro station entrance one minute away (and metro so easy to use)plenty of sites within easy/pleasant walking distance (closest is eiffel tower) and everything else easily acessible by metro. Staff were very friendly and helpful - the closest brasserie on the left as you walk out of the front door of hotel was our favorite and serves meals from breakfast through to supper. We ate there most days for at least one of our meals. Remember you are in Paris - don't expect what you would get in America or other places and just enjoy the differences. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec 2004 for 5 nights. The hotel had the room ready for us when we arrived at 7 am, even though we hadn't requested it. The room was nice, the staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was expensive but good, and conveniant. Excellent location, close to the metros and major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 weeks in Belgium and decided to include a weekend trip to Paris. After careful consideration, we chose the Hotel Tourville based on reviews from this site and recommendations from relatives that had stayed there previously. We could not have been happier with our decision! The Hotel was in a quiet neighborhood a few blocks away from the Eiffel Tower and one block away from a Metro station. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly - they assisted us with all of our questions, booked dinner and show reservations for us, and secured our luggage after check out so we could enjoy the remainder of our last day in Paris. The room was fairly small, which is typical in Europe, and had a balcony. It was very clean, the maid service was very prompt and the bathroom was very well done. Overall, we greatly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.
